text:
Windows first creates a collection "New Folder" and then renames it to the 
actual name. The "Destination" header of that move method is decoded but windows 
doesn't encode the "+" sign. Maybe somebody can change the decode routine to:

"http://host:port/a+b?c"  => "http://host:port/a+b?c"
"http://host:port/a?b+c"  => "http://host:port/a?b c"

And only change "+" to " " after "?".
creator: dirk.verbeeck@pandora.be

text:
According to the URI specifications the plus sign MUST not be encoded.

The problem is in unescape(..) method of org.util.apache.URIUtil.java.
This routine always converts a '+' to a space. It is used in the getPath()
method of GenericURI.java
 
This conversion from plus to space would be correct for handling such query
parameters which are explizitly defined to be in the mime-type
x-www-form-urlencoded, but isn´t correct for escaping path components.
Slide uses an rather old version ( well in fact two *sigh* ) of the jakarta
commons package. The current version provides an additional boolean 'encodePlus'
parameter on the unescape method.

Best fix would be to update the http-commons component in slide and eliminate
duplicate classes in old org.apache.util package.

I am attaching an interim patch, which just eliminates the unecessary encoding.
IMHO changing the plus to a space even after the question mark isn´t a good idea
either as the query parameter CAN, but must not necessarly be an
x-www-form-urlencoded string.
creator: bernd.eilers@sun.com
